speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: SCENE IV. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Enter COUNTESS and Steward

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Alas! and would you take the letter of her?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Might you not know she would do as she has done,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: By sending me a letter? Read it again.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: [Reads]

speaker: Steward
text_entry: I am Saint Jaques' pilgrim, thither gone:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Ambitious love hath so in me offended,

speaker: Steward
text_entry: That barefoot plod I the cold ground upon,

speaker: Steward
text_entry: With sainted vow my faults to have amended.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Write, write, that from the bloody course of war

speaker: Steward
text_entry: My dearest master, your dear son, may hie:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Bless him at home in peace, whilst I from far

speaker: Steward
text_entry: His name with zealous fervor sanctify:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: His taken labours bid him me forgive;

speaker: Steward
text_entry: I, his despiteful Juno, sent him forth

speaker: Steward
text_entry: From courtly friends, with camping foes to live,

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Where death and danger dogs the heels of worth:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: He is too good and fair for death and me:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Whom I myself embrace, to set him free.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Ah, what sharp stings are in her mildest words!

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Rinaldo, you did never lack advice so much,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: As letting her pass so: had I spoke with her,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I could have well diverted her intents,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Which thus she hath prevented.

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Pardon me, madam:

speaker: Steward
text_entry: If I had given you this at over-night,

speaker: Steward
text_entry: She might have been o'erta'en; and yet she writes,

speaker: Steward
text_entry: Pursuit would be but vain.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: What angel shall

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Bless this unworthy husband? he cannot thrive,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Unless her prayers, whom heaven delights to hear

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: And loves to grant, reprieve him from the wrath

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Of greatest justice. Write, write, Rinaldo,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To this unworthy husband of his wife;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Let every word weigh heavy of her worth

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: That he does weigh too light: my greatest grief.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Though little he do feel it, set down sharply.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Dispatch the most convenient messenger:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: When haply he shall hear that she is gone,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: He will return; and hope I may that she,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Hearing so much, will speed her foot again,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Led hither by pure love: which of them both

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Is dearest to me. I have no skill in sense

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: To make distinction: provide this messenger:

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: My heart is heavy and mine age is weak;

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Grief would have tears, and sorrow bids me speak.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: Exeunt
